3.4 20071211_0010

I have a java file opened with the Java editor.  The file is from a java project in the workspace.

The editor had two yellow tool tip when it stops updating.  One is the debug instruction pointer tooltip.  I am not sure what the other one was.

Found the following error in the log when the Java Editor stops updating.

Also happens when debugging and stepping quickly.  I experienced the same problem when I step quickly by holding down the F6 key.

>when it stops updating. 
What exactly do you mean by that? Was this the only error in the .log?

This looks like something strange is going on as the main/UI thread reports:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3716)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3634)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3605)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:441)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:335)
        at
org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.getBackground(StyledText.java:3054)
        at org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.handlePaint(StyledText.java:5291)

Moving to SWT for comment.

When this error happens, I noticed that the tooltip sticks.  The debugger is unable to highlight source when I step.  I get the exception everytime I do a step.  The editor didi not paint when I move the workbench around.  I guess a better description is that the editor stops painting.

Good lord!  Another one.  Can you make it happen every time?  Comment #1 suggests you can.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 209212 ***

No, I am unable to reproduce consistently.
More info on the environment:
* Windows Vista Business Edition
* IBM JVM 1.6 GA 
  - also tried IBM 1.6 internal build: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build   pwi3260-20071017_04) - this one is slightly older than the GA version

* Running with Remote Desktop
Boris, do you have any ideas.  People are starting to see this and we have no idea how it could be happening.  Is it possible that another display is created?

Got it to happen again.  If there is anything that you would like me to collect, let me know.

It seems to happen to files that I have newly imported into the workspace or checked out from CVS.  But when I got the exceptions last time, I was debugging a file that I just imported into the workspace.  This time, I was debugigng a file that I just checked out from CVS.
In bug 209212, there is a method you could run but you need to patch SWT.  Please move the discussion over there so that other people who are seeing this problem can follow along.
It would be great if you could help us debug this!
